description: From Middle English spedily, spedili, from Old English *spēdiġlīċe, ġespēdiġlīċe (“prosperously”), equivalent to speedy +‎ -ly. Cognate with Scots spedely, spedelie (“quickly, speedily”). Compare also Old English spēdlīċe (“effectually, effectively, successfully, efficaciously, powerfully, in a manner which produces a result”).

adverbs.description: speedily (comparative speedilier or more speedily, superlative speediliest or most speedily)

entries.meaning: In a speedy or fast manner.
